page.title: 03CUSTOMS
page.content: Many Farnworth churches have Rose Queens. The Rose Queen is a girl usually aged between 9 and 16. She wears a long dress and a train. She is usually crowned in May or June. She has young girls as train bearers and ladies in waiting. She might have boys as cushion bearer and sword bearers. At St. John's the retiring Queen leads a procession through the streets behind a band and followed by her retinue. People collect money which goes to the Rose Queen fund and the church. The Rose Queen attends some special church services in her regalia. Each Rose Queen visits about twenty other churches during her reign to compete against other Rose Queens. They are judged for appearance and personality. Cups or shields are presented to the winners.
